message.content:
Firstly, let's clarify how exactly Harmony used the discarded paper for her notepads. It is likely that she folded the paper in the shape of a heart or some other special shape before cutting along the lines to create the notepad. 

Assuming that Harmony folded the letter size paper into an envelope-like shape, cut along the lines and stapled the papers together using a staple gun, one notepad would last approximately 6 months if someone wrote ten notes per day for an entire year (365 days). This is because each note requires writing, folding, cutting, and stapling all in roughly 10 minutes, which means over 10,000 minutes or 17.5 days for a full year of writing ten notes per day.

However, it's important to note that this calculation assumes that the rate of writing (ten notes per day) remains constant throughout the entire year. In reality, the number of notes written may vary slightly depending on the month and other factors. To get a more accurate estimate of how long one notepad would last if someone wrote ten notes per day for an entire year (365 days), you would need to adjust the calculation based on the actual rate of writing over the course of a year.
